name: GridSystem
description: Adds tools to make complex shapes and push them around with each other.
1. Add the `Grid object` behavior to all objects that can interact with each other.
2. Set the grid size with the `Set grid` action.
3. Connect objects together to make more complex Grobjects (see below)
4. Flag objects that you want to move with the `Flag for moving` action.
5. Use the `Calculate movement` action to calculate which objects will move.
6. Use the `Can move` condition on the objects, and move them accordingly.

The extension often refers to things called "grobject". These are made of one or more connected objects with the `Grid object` behavior. Objects in the same grobject will stick to each other when calculating their movement.
It is important that you don't mix the two things together. An object is an object, and a grobject is one or more objects connected (yes. a single object on its own is also a grobject)!

eventsFunctions.description:
Set the grid's size across all scenes (globally).
This grid will only affect actions of this extension.
eventsFunctions.name: SetGrid

eventsFunctions.description:
Calculate the movement of all grobjects.
All flagged grobjects (at least one flagged object) attempt to move one grid step in the specified direction, pushing other grobjects in the way.
This action does not make any of the objects actually move. It only calculates if the objects could move or not. To see the results, use the "Can move" condition on the objects.
eventsFunctions.name: Calculate
eventsFunctions.sentence: Calculate the movement of _PARAM1_ objects by moving all flagged grobjects one grid step in the _PARAM3_ direction

events.comment:
1. For each flagged grobject.
2. While there are still grobjects to check in RemainingGrobjects.
3. Check next to (in the specified direction) each object in the currently checked grobject.
   If the found object (if any) ...
   * ... is from a different grobject than the one currently being checked, add its GrobjectIdentifier to RemainingGrobjects (so it will also be checked later).
   * ... is static, stop checking this flagged grobject, and set all grobjects leading up to the static grobject to static.
4. If no static grobjects were found, all objects checked are marked with CanMove.
Turn the direction string into X and Y values
If an object is set to static, set its grobject temporarily to static as well
If an object is set to flagged, set its grobject to flagged as well
For every flagged grobject, start the whole process by adding them to RemainingGrobjects and Added
Do these while there are still stuff to calculate in RemainingGrobjects
Add the first grobject's identifier to its own FamilyLine
Check for an object next to each object in the grobject
If the object is from a new grobject (it isn't in Added) add it to RemainingGrobjects, Added and copy the identifiers from the previous grobject's FamilyLine to this grobject's FamilyLine
Possible optimisation: If the found grobject is already moving, stop checking this line of grobjects.
If the found grobject is static, stop checking the current flagged grobject
The FamilyLine stores all the identifiers of the grobjects that tried to push this static grobject. Set all of these grobjects to static (temporarily)
If the calculation didin't run into any static grobjects, all objects marked with CouldMove are marked with CanMove (which is what the user uses to determine if an object can move or not)
Reset CouldMove, Added and FamilyLine for the next flagged grobject

parameters.description: Object group that the movement might interact with
parameters.longDescription: This must include the flagged objects, pushable objects, and static objects. Anything that isn't included will be entirely ignored.
parameters.name: Group

eventsFunctions.description:
Slice an object into grid-objects (forming a grobject out of them), taking into account its width and height.
Objects will be created on the same layer and with the same z-order as the sliced object.
The action won't delete the sliced object.
eventsFunctions.name: Slice

parameters.description: Objects to replace the sliced object with
parameters.name: ObjectReplace

eventsFunctions.description: Return an X or Y position (-1, 0, or 1) from a direction.
eventsFunctions.name: DirectionToPosition

eventsFunctions.description:
Return a direction from an angle.
Valid angles are: ... -90, 0, 90, 180, 270, 360, 450 ...
eventsFunctions.name: AngleToDirection

eventsFunctions.description: the number of objects that can move (from the last calculation).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Number of objects that can move
eventsFunctions.name: MovingObjects
eventsFunctions.sentence: The number of objects that can move from the last calculation

eventsFunctions.description: the number of grobjects that can move (from the last calculation).
eventsFunctions.fullName: Number of Grobjects that can move
eventsFunctions.name: MovingGrobjects
eventsFunctions.sentence: The number of grobjects that can move from the last calculation

eventsFunctions.description: Return the direction that was used in the last calculation.
eventsFunctions.name: LastDirection

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows the object to interact with the grid system controller.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: GridObject

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is static.
eventsFunctions.name: Static

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object has interaction enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: Interaction

eventsFunctions.description: Connect the objects together by a number expression. Objects with the same number will be connected together.
eventsFunctions.name: ConnectFromNumber
eventsFunctions.sentence: Connect _PARAM0_ objects together using _PARAM2_ as grouping numbers. Important: _PARAM3_

events.comment: Hacky workaround to clear Connect. Contact me on discord or github if you know how to fix it (or just do a pull request or whatever its called).

parameters.longDescription: Please use the expression PickedInstancesCount(ObjectName) here. This is unfortunately required. If you know how to fix this, please let me know!
parameters.name: PickedInstancesCount

eventsFunctions.description: Disconnect from the object's current grobject, forming a grobject of its own.
eventsFunctions.name: Disconnect

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object can move after calculating its movement.
eventsFunctions.name: CanMove

eventsFunctions.description: Give the object a new grobject identifier.
eventsFunctions.name: NewGrobjectIdentifier

events.comment: All identifier names are strings so they can be used as variable names in structure variables (instead of array variables).

propertyDescriptors.label: Interaction
propertyDescriptors.description: If turned off, the object can not interact with other grobjects, but it can still be connected, set its grobject static, etc...
propertyDescriptors.name: Interaction
